Questions.QuestionString: Where can you find characteristics and complimentary information of the Part Number: (level 1)
Answers: IPC or AMM
ASM or AMM
IPC or ESPM

Questions.QuestionString: Where you can find procedure for installation of the Push Button switch: (level 1)
Answers: AMM
ASM
ESPM

Questions.QuestionString: In the AMM tasks, “WARNING” is meant: (level 1)
Answers: Calls attention to use of materials, processes, methods, procedures or limits which must be followed precisely to avoid injury of death to persons
Calls attention to methods and procedures which be followed to avoid damage to equipment
Calls attention to methods which make the job easier or provide supplementary or explanatory information

Questions.QuestionString: In the AMM tasks, “CAUTION” is meant: (level 2)
Answers: Calls attention to use of materials, processes, methods, procedures or limits which must be followed precisely to avoid injury of death to persons
Calls attention to methods and procedures which be followed to avoid damage to equipment
Calls attention to methods which make the job easier or provide supplementary or explanatory information

Questions.QuestionString: In the AMM tasks, “NOTE” is meant: (level 2)
Answers: Calls attention to use of materials, processes, methods, procedures or limits which must be followed precisely to avoid injury of death to persons
Calls attention to methods and procedures which be followed to avoid damage to equipment
Calls attention to methods which make the job easier or provide supplementary or explanatory information

Questions.QuestionString: ASM gives: (level 2)
Answers: Schematic diagrams of the electrical installation with sufficient data for A/C fault isolation
Wiring diagrams of the electrical installation
The status of the item of equipment, semi-equipment and related wiring

Questions.QuestionString: TSM gives: (level 3)
Answers: Information required for trouble shooting is contained in the manual
The status of the item of equipment, semi-equipment and related wiring
Schematic diagrams of the electrical installation with sufficient data for A/C fault isolation

Questions.QuestionString: AWM gives: (level 3)
Answers: Wiring diagrams of the electrical installation
Schematic diagrams of the electrical installation with sufficient data for A/C fault isolation
The status of the item of equipment, semi-equipment and related wiring

Questions.QuestionString: AMM gives: (level 3)
Answers: Information required for trouble shooting is contained in the manual
The information required to service, repair, replace, adjust, inspect and check equipments and systems of the A/C normally performed on the ramp or in the maintenance hangar
Schematic diagrams of the electrical installation with sufficient data for A/C fault isolation

Questions.QuestionString: You can access to the Aircraft Wiring List (AWL) by: (E&A Repair) (level 2)
Answers: Fin using the EQUIPMENT LIST or HOOK-UP LIST
Fin using the EQUIPMENT LIST or HOOK-UP LIST or by wire number using the MASTER WIRE LIST
Wire number using the MASTER WIRE LIST

Questions.QuestionString: What statement is true? (level 1)
Answers: The MMEL must be used as a reference by the Operator to develop its MEL.
The MEL must be used as a reference by the Operator to develop its MMEL
MMEL must be more strictly than MEL
